qas.question: Who was the president of Moldova in 1996?
In what year was a Moldovan-Romanian dictionary published?
Fear of what caused the Moldovan parliament to reject changing the name of the country's language to Romanian in 1996?
Who was the head of the Academy of Sciences of Moldova?
Political purposes have been reclassified to deliberately do what?
When did the Moldovan parliament approve a proposal from President Snegur?
When was President Moldovan's proposal rejected by parliament?

plausible_answers.text: all the Moldovan words were also Romanian words

qas.question: What did the Academy of Science declare regarding Moldovan words?
When was the Romanian-Academy dictionary published?

context: There have been cases of a variety of speech being deliberately reclassified to <b4_0>serve political purposes<b4_0/>. One example is Moldovan. In <b5_0><b6_0>1996<b6_0/><b5_0/>, the Moldovan parliament, citing fears of "<a2_0>Romanian expansionism<a2_0/>", rejected a proposal from President <a0_0>Mircea Snegur<a0_0/> to change the name of the language to Romanian, and in <a1_0><b8_0>2003<b8_0/><a1_0/> a Moldovan–Romanian dictionary was published, purporting to show that the two countries speak different languages. Linguists of the Romanian Academy reacted by declaring that <b7_0>all the Moldovan words were also Romanian words<b7_0/>; while in Moldova, the head of the Academy of Sciences of Moldova, <a3_0>Ion Bărbuţă<a3_0/>, described the dictionary as a politically motivated "absurdity".
